WorkItem.ClosedComment: Declining this, use in-game wishlist addons like atlas loot. Otherwise for Rawr, do Direct Upgrades and Upgrades lists. These are both exportable to CSV for fuddling with in Excel and maybe printing out.
WorkItem.Description:
I use Rawr to select my optimum gear most of the time... but that's just for my "veterans". For my newly dinged level 80's I mostly use it as a wish list, but it would be great to have both functions.
 
Is it possible to add another "diamond" to check for gear that you want to get, e.g.- from heroics or by badges, change these into the normal green ones once you have them to be able to run the optimizer.
 
It would also be great to be able to export this wish list or show it based on source. E.g.- sorting it by instance for example showing:
 
Utgarde Pinnacle [Normal]
[Slot] [Drop Source] [Rating]
[Slot] [Drop Source] [Rating] 
 
Utgarde Pinnacle [Heroic]
[Slot] [Drop Source] [Rating]
[Slot] [Drop Source] [Rating]
 
just my thought, would really improve the way I think most people use Rawr already, the current optimizer includes all the gear from the selected filters, but doesn't really sort it in any accessible way in my opinion.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request] Wishlist function and exporting by source

Comments.Message: You can create wish lists with in-game add-ons like AtlasLoot. Which is a much better system for wish lists I think than putting it in Rawr.
true, but for atlas I have to use WoW... I constantly have Rawr running at work browsing gear, can't have WoW running there, my boss would get... ehm... upset
Not exactly what you're asking for, but maybe this idea will help you out.  You can Build an Upgrade List, export it as a CSV and then load it into any spreadsheet. Then sort by Source and Rating.
